page.title: 14THE LEISURE CENTRE
page.content: {Bishop Auckland Leisure Complex}began as a swimming pool in 1969 and opend to the public as a leisure centre on 7th May 1985.The complex is one of a number in the district run by {Wear {Valley District Council.}It employs 18 full-time workers and 3 part-time. On average{3600 people use the facilities each week. It has taken 2 years and Â£178,000 to build the complex around the pool. Attendances have increased but swimming is still the most popular activity. The complex now offers the following {activities:-}swimming, canoeing, sub-aqua diving, sauna, solarium, snooker, pool, jacuzzi, multi-purpose gym, squash and table-tennis. There is also a cafe for meals and snacks. The complex has easy access and hoists in both pools for {disabled people.
